medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain, chest pain, and cough productive of green phlegm.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports the onset of abdominal pain approximately one year ago, with a sharp burning constant abdominal pain radiating to the chest occurring about one week prior to admission. The abdominal pain is diffuse, intensifying with eating or drinking, while lying flat helps relieve it. The chest pain is of a burning type and developed after the onset of abdominal pain. The patient also developed a cough productive of 'chunks of blood' within the last several days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes with peripheral neuropathy, chronic back pain, hypothyroidism, history of abdominal surgery due to knife stabbing injury.
